xinstall package¶

Submodules¶

xinstall.ai module¶

Install AI related tools.

xinstall.ai.autogluon(**kwargs)[source]¶

Insert the Python package AutoGluon.

xinstall.ai.computer_vision(**kwargs)[source]¶

Insert computer vision Python packages: opencv-python, scikit-image and Pillow.

xinstall.ai.gensim(**kwargs)[source]¶

Insert the Python package GenSim.

xinstall.ai.kaggle(**kwargs)[source]¶

Insert the Python package kaggle.

xinstall.ai.lightgbm(**kwargs)[source]¶

Insert the Python package kaggle.

xinstall.ai.nlp(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install Python packages (PyTorch, transformers, pytext-nlp and fasttext) for NLP.

xinstall.ai.pytext(**kwargs)[source]¶

Insert the Python package PyText.

xinstall.ai.pytorch(**kwargs)[source]¶

Insert PyTorch.

xinstall.ai.tensorflow(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install the Python package TensorFlow. Since the most common to use TensorFlow is to install it into a Docker image that already come with Nvidia CUDA support, GPU support/dependencies (CUDA and CuDNN) is not handled here. You need to manually install CUDA and CuDNN if you need GPU support. For more details, please refer to https://www.tensorflow.org/install/gpu.

xinstall.bigdata module¶

Install big data related tools.

xinstall.bigdata.dask(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install the Python module dask. :param yes: :param install: :param config: :param uninstall:

xinstall.bigdata.optimuspyspark(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install Optimus (a PySpark package for data profiling). :param yes: :param install: :param config: :param uninstall: :param version:

xinstall.bigdata.pyspark(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install PySpark. :param yes: :param install: :param config: :param uninstall: :param version:

xinstall.bigdata.spark(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install Spark. :param yes: :param install: :param config: :param uninstall: :param version:

xinstall.desktop module¶

Install and configure desktop applications.

xinstall.desktop.lxqt(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install the LXQt desktop environment.

xinstall.desktop.nomachine(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install NoMachine.

xinstall.desktop.pygetwindow(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install and configure the Python package PyGetWindow.

xinstall.dev module¶

Installing dev related tools.

xinstall.dev.antlr(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install and configure Antrl4.

xinstall.dev.deno(**kwargs)[source]¶
xinstall.dev.git(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Install and configure Git.

xinstall.dev.git_ignore(**kwargs)[source]¶

Insert patterns to ingore into .gitignore in the current directory.

xinstall.dev.ipython(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install IPython for Python 3.

xinstall.dev.jpype1(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install the Python package JPype.

xinstall.dev.nodejs(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install nodejs and npm.

xinstall.dev.openjdk8(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install OpenJDK 8.

xinstall.dev.poetry(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install and configure Python poetry.

xinstall.dev.pyjnius(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install pyjnius for calling Java from Python.

xinstall.dev.python3(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install and configure Python 3.

xinstall.dev.rust(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install the Rust programming language (rustc and cargo) (to system-wide locations using apt-get instead of to ~/.cargo using rustup).

xinstall.dev.rustpython(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install and configure RustPython.

xinstall.dev.rustup(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install rustup which is the version management tool for Rust.

xinstall.dev.sdkman(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install sdkman. https://sdkman.io/install

xinstall.dev.yapf(**kwargs)[source]¶

Install Google’s yapf (for formatting Python scripts).

xinstall.github module¶

GitHub related utils.

xinstall.github.dsutil(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Install the Python package dsutil.

xinstall.github.install_py_github(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Install a Python package from GitHub.

xinstall.github.xinstall(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Install xonsh, a Python based shell.

xinstall.jupyter module¶

Install and configure Jupyter/Lab related tools.

xinstall.jupyter.almond(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Install/uninstall/configure the Almond Scala kernel.

xinstall.jupyter.beakerx(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Install/uninstall/configure the BeakerX kernels.

xinstall.jupyter.evcxr_jupyter(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Install the evcxr Rust kernel for Jupyter/Lab server.

xinstall.jupyter.itypescript(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Install and configure the ITypeScript kernel.

xinstall.jupyter.jupyterlab_lsp(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Install jupyterlab-lsp.

xinstall.jupyter.nbdime(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Install and configure nbdime for comparing difference of notebooks.

xinstall.main module¶

The command-line interface for xinstall.

xinstall.main.main()[source]¶

Run xinstall command-line interface.

xinstall.main.parse_args(args=None, namespace=None)[source]¶

Parse command-line arguments for the install/configuration util.

xinstall.main.version(**kwargs)[source]¶

Print the version of xinstall.

xinstall.shell module¶

Install shell (command-line) related tools.

xinstall.shell.bash_completion(**kwargs) → None[source]¶
xinstall.shell.bash_it(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Install Bash-it, a community Bash framework. For more details, please refer to https://github.com/Bash-it/bash-it#installation.

xinstall.shell.change_shell(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Change the default shell.

xinstall.shell.coreutils(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Install CoreUtils.

xinstall.shell.exa(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Install exa which is an Rust-implemented alternative to ls.

xinstall.shell.homebrew(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Install Homebrew.

xinstall.shell.hyper(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Install the hyper.js terminal.

xinstall.shell.openinterminal(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Install openinterminal.

xinstall.shell.osquery(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Install osquery for Linux admin.

xinstall.shell.shell_utils(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Install Shell-related utils.

xinstall.shell.wajig(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Install wajig.

xinstall.shell.xonsh(**kwargs) → None[source]¶

Install xonsh, a Python based shell.

xinstall.utils module¶

Helper functions.

xinstall.utils.add_subparser(subparsers, name: str, func: Callable, aliases: Sequence = (), help_: Optional[str] = None, add_argument: Optional[Callable] = None) → None[source]¶

Add a sub parser to the main parser.

Parameters

  • subparsers – The subparsers handler.

  • name – The name of the sub command.

  • func – The function corresponding to the sub parser.

  • aliases (Sequence, optional) – A list of aliases of the sub command.

  • help (Union[str, None], optional) – Help doc of the sub command. If None, then the help doc of func is used.

  • add_argument (Union[Callable, None], optional) – A callable object to add aditional arguments (in addition to those default arguments), defaults to None

xinstall.utils.brew_install_safe(pkgs: Union[str, List]) → None[source]¶

Using Homebrew to install without throwing exceptions if a package to install already exists. :param pkgs: A (list of) package(s) to install using Homebrew.

xinstall.utils.copy_file(srcfile, dstfile)[source]¶

Copy file without throwing exceptions when a broken symbolic link already exists at the destination. :param srcfile: The source file to copy from. :param dstfile: The destination file to copy to.

xinstall.utils.copy_if_exists(src: Union[pathlib.Path, str], dst: pathlib.Path = PosixPath('/Users/dclong')) → bool[source]¶

Copy a file. No exception is thrown if the source file does not exist. :param src: The path of the source file. :param dst: The path of the destination file.

xinstall.utils.install_py_github(url: str, user: bool = False, pip: str = 'pip3') → None[source]¶

Automatically install the latest version of a Python package from its GitHub repository. :param url: The root URL of the GitHub repository. :param user: If True, install to user’s local directory. This option is equivalant to ‘pip install –user’. :param pip: The path (pip3 by default) to the pip executable.

xinstall.utils.intellij_idea_plugin(version: str, url: str)[source]¶

Install the specified plugin for IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition. :param version: The version of IntelliJ IDEA. :param url: The download URL of the plugin to install.

xinstall.utils.is_centos_series()[source]¶

Check whehter the current OS belongs to the CentOS series (CentOS, RedHat or Fedora).

xinstall.utils.is_fedora()[source]¶

Check whehter the current OS is Fedora.

xinstall.utils.is_linux()[source]¶

Check whehter the current OS is Linux.

xinstall.utils.is_macos()[source]¶

Check whehter the current OS is macOS.

xinstall.utils.is_ubuntu_debian()[source]¶

Check whehter the current OS is Ubuntu/Debian.

xinstall.utils.is_win()[source]¶

Check whehter the current OS is Windows.

xinstall.utils.link_if_exists(src: Union[pathlib.Path, str], dst: pathlib.Path = PosixPath('/Users/dclong'), target_is_directory: bool = True) → bool[source]¶

Make a symbolic link of a file. No exception is thrown if the source file does not exist. :param src: The path of the source file. :param dst: The path of the destination file.

xinstall.utils.namespace(dic: Dict) → argparse.Namespace[source]¶

Convert a dictionary object to an argpase Namespace.

Parameters

dic – A dictionary object.

Returns

An argparse Namespace.

Add the option –python into the sub parser.

subparser – A sub parser.

xinstall.utils.option_user(subparser)[source]¶
xinstall.utils.remove_file_safe(path: pathlib.Path) → None[source]¶

Remove a file or sybmolic link. :param path: The path to the file or symbolic link.

xinstall.utils.run_cmd(cmd: Union[List, str]) → None[source]¶

Run a shell command. :param cmd: The command to run.

xinstall.utils.to_bool(value: Any) → bool[source]¶

Convert an object to a bool value (True or False).

Parameters

value – any object that can be converted to a bool value.

Returns

True or False.

xinstall.utils.update_apt_source(yes: bool = True, seconds: float = 43200)[source]¶

Run apt-get update if necessary. :param yes: If True, automatically yes to prompt questions. :param seconds: Do not run if this function has already been run seconds seconds ago.
